label: 礼銭礼物
説明文: Most debtors and creditors seeking protection under the 1526 debt-relief edict also gave the Director of the Shogunal Administrative Office (Mandokoro Tōnin) additional gifts in cash or kind, called Courtesy Money" (Reisen) or "Courtesy Goods" (Reimotsu), inducements to sign off on the official guarantee documents.#[article]Ishizaki Kenji. The Financial Relationship between Buichisen and Reisen reimotsu in the "Ten Per Cent Debt-relief Edict" (Buichi tokusei-rei) of 1529."
